data.title: Delicious
data.text:
Restaurant with character, friendly service and delicious food.

You can choose the protein for the food; beef, chicken, tofu and I think there was another protein type too. As soon as I said tofu, the waitress immediately asked if I was a vegetarian and had the food made without fish oil. That was just fantastic attention to detail.

data.title: A good time for all
data.text: We took a business partner here for dinner with our family and had a delightful time. The food was very tasty and very reasonably priced. The atmosphere was simple, you bring the excitement.  This is a good restaurant to be able to eat out on a regular basis without breaking the bank.

data.title: Don't Judge a Book by It's Cover
data.text: This Thai restaurant was highly recommended by an associate of mine.  It is located in a strip center in Cedar Park and the appearance of the restaurant itself is average at best.  But don't let that stop you!  They have a varied menu of Thai dishes, and if you're a lover of Thai food, you won't be disappointed.  We had a party of 3 that visited during a week night.  It wasn't very crowded the night we were there. I ordered an appetizer of the vegetarian egg rolls and they were outstanding.  They were larger than normal and loaded with cabbage & veggies and it came with a sweet, red chili dipping sauce.  For entrees my wife had the pad thai with chicken, the other person in our party had the sweet & sour Thai chicken and I had the Thai noodles with beef.  My wife loved her Pad Thai.  The chicken was tender & flavorful, the noodles were done perfectly and it came with fresh bean sprouts, other veggies and crushed peanuts.  The person who had the Thai sweet and sour chicken went crazy over it!!  The Thai style comes with sliced, unbreaded chicken with lots of fresh carrots and other vegetables.  My dish was probably the most disappointing.  I like spicy Thai dishes and I ordered a "4" out of 5 on the spice scale and I was not disappointed in that.  It definitely was spicy - the way I like it!  There was not a lot of beef in my dish.  It was cut up into small pieces -- which is okay -- but it was very tough.  I'd go with the chicken the next time.  The prices are very reasonable and I can't say enough about the excellent service we received from our server.  She was polite and attentive.

data.title: Excellent luncheon specials, quick service, great food
data.text: My daughter, her baby, & I went here for lunch. We started w/steamed dumplings. They served 5 small ones w/small amount of sauce. They were delicious! We chose to order luncheon specials, which came w/soup & white rice.  The cup of Tom Kha soup was very appealing. My daughter ordered yellow curry while I had pad ginger without carrots. Both meals were fabulous, w/great tastes. My daughter said she had not tasted such good yellow curry in a long time. I thought my meal, with the wonderful ginger slivers, was truly excellent. Price was extremely reasonable & service, good. If I lived in Austin, I would definitely make this my go-to Thai place!

data.title: I was hoping for more.
data.text: We decided to try this place as we in the area, but maybe we picked a bad time.  On an early July day, it was cooler in the parking lot than in the restaurant.  My side salad was a cup of chopped iceberg lettuce with satay peanut sauce serving as the dressing.  It was a new experience for me.  The penang curry was good, though lacking in proteins it had plenty of green beans to compensate for the lack of chicken.  Our server wasn't really serving us, and I never did get the napkins I requested to wipe the perspiration off of my face.  My wife's noodle dish was a bit better, but all in all, our visit was a disappointment.  I've had great thai food all over the country, so this was to what I expected after reading the previous reviews.

data.title: Reliably Good
data.text:
We ate at Thamnak Thai again tonight.- good as always.  Two of us had the excellent Mussaman Curry.  It had a good curry flavor without burning out everyone's mouth.  

I had the red curry, which was an excellent call.  This curry is more aggressive than the Mussaman, but's still oh so smooth.  It has a stronger flavor and a great burn.  

My son, who is not a curry fan, had the beef and broccoli, which he enjoyed.

The other thing we enjoy at Thanmak is the Thai tea.  Smooth, flavorful, sweet, but not too sweet.  It's really good stuff.

We have never had a bad meal Thanmak, and we have always enjoyed the quiet armosphere.

data.title: Great Thai hole-in-the-wall
data.text:
Wow!  I don't know why I haven't discovered this place until now, but my lunch was awesome!  I am a Thai food snob, I'll admit.  Thai food here in the Austin area is very hit or miss.  This restaurant is somewhat hidden in a strip mall.  

The service was friendly, attentive, and fast.  My husband and I were in and out within 30 minutes.

I had the Pad Thai with chicken.  It came with a egg roll and choice of soup or salad.  The soup choices change daily.  Friday is Tom Kha, which was very fresh and very flavorful.   

The prices are very reasonable, and portions are just right.  I loved the food!  This is my new Thai place!

data.title: Delicious food every time we go
data.text: I am never disappointed with the quality of the food at this restaurant.  The veggies and spices in the meal are wonderful.  Every dish we have had here is very flavorful.  This is a great restaurant to have in Cedar Park.   We usually go here for take-out meals, but we have dined in also and have never had a bad experience.

data.title: Okay Thai food for lunch
data.text: I've eaten here a couple times for lunch.  The atmosphere in the restaurant is nice and appropriate.  Service is good and efficient.  But the food is "just okay" in my opinion.  The meat does not taste fresh and the flavors are not quite what I'm used to in Thai food.  Maybe it is an americanized version?

data.title: Decent prices, decent food.
data.text: We got take-out here the other night and it was pretty decent. The green curry was very hot, next time I'll ask them to take the heat down a notch. My husband enjoyed his pineapple curry with shrimp and my 8 yo enjoyed her beef & broccoli. My 12 yo got the garlic shrimp and ate his whole portion. Good sized portions, friendly staff, would come here again.

data.title: My Daughter's Choice for Birthday Dinner
data.text: We live in Cedar Park and there are several good places to eat.  Out of all these places, my daughter picked Thamnak Thai for her birthday dinner.  We like the Mussaman and Panang curries.  Everything is good.  This is a mom and pop store where the husband runs the front while the wife runs the kitchen.  We very much recommend.

data.title: Excellent Thai food in Cedar Park
data.text: My husband and I eat here frequently & we bring friends who turn into new returning customers. The seafood soup is excellent; all dishes we have tried are fresh, hot & just fantastic. We highly recommend this restaurant!!

data.title: Great food!!
data.text: We went here with family and ordered a bunch of different stuff to share.  The Pad Thai was excellent and the Pineapple Curry with shrimp was great as well.  We each had a Thai egg roll and a soft spring roll.....very good with delicious sauces!!  Overall, it was a very good place to eat.

data.title: Really good Thai food
data.text: Nice spice and great flavor!!  Loved it!!  Found this place based on tripadvisor. My son loved it too

data.title: Did not like the food
data.text: We have been to several Thai places.. But would not recommend this one

data.title: Consistently tasty!  Great for take-out.
data.text: Love their Panang coconut curry with tofu--very fresh and flavorful.  I do take-out here quite a bit, and they are always extremely punctual.

data.title: Excellent Thai, excellent value.
data.text: I've tried just about everything on the lunch menu, and it's all been great. High quality Thai food at an affordable price. Friendly service, great value for the money.  The spicy/heat level can be adjusted - just ask. Well worth it.

data.title: Best Thai food in Austin! (We like it even better than Thai food in Thailand!)
data.text:
We have visited BangKok and Chiang Mai a couple of times in the last few years. On each occasion, we missed Thamnak Thai's dishes at home! This says it all about our opinion on this Thai restaurant.
It is a family oriented, located in a hard to find strip mall in Cedar Park, north of Austin, with plenty of parking spaces. The restaurant is kind of a smaller size. The chef cook is from Northern Thailand and her husband is running the dining area. They are both super nice. And their food, as we headlined it, is better than Thai dishes in Thailand, in our own opinion. (Disclosure: we are Vietnamese Americans). The one thing that could be improved is faster service!
We always order Panang Tofu with Curry, Pad See EEw with squids, Tamarine and Fish Sauce Fish dish, Clear Noodle with Chicken Soup. Always! And the price is just right! What a treat to have the best Thai food in town without having to fly to Thailand!

data.title: Delicious authentic thai cuisine
data.text: Thamnak Thai is one of the few restaurants that does not sacrifice authenticity, quality, or amount of their food for an economical price. While you can get a meal for $5-$10, it is not because the ingredients are cheap or the portions are skimpy. Whenever I eat there, I get enough food for two meals, and enjoy it the second day just as much as I did when it was served to me fresh and hot. The service is also splendid for the most part, and they are willing to adjust dishes to your personal taste. For example, I love their green curry fried rice but I prefer it at two star spiciness rather than the three it is listed at. Thamnak Thai's lunch menu boasts their most popular dishes and generously comes with soup and an egg roll, all for under $10. Their dinner menu contains a wide variety of dishes, including soups, noodles, fried rice, curries, and seafood. Their seafood is high quality, so you might pay a little more for it, but you are much less likely to have adverse gastrointestinal effects. There is no price for avoiding sickness! The red snapper is absolutely phenomenal, so order that and don't share, because you will finish it by yourself. The restaurant has lots of booths and Thai decor, providing a cozy atmosphere that is casual but not trashy. Overall, I highly recommend Thamnak Thai as a great place to take your family, friends, or coworkers.

data.title: Addicting
data.text:
This has been one of our family favorites for 3 years.  The food is fresh, hot and delicious.  Only twice, out of several dozen of visits, has a dish not been below its usual excellence, which I feel is a great track record.

The decor isn't fancy, but then neither are the prices.  The price is very reasonable for the generous portions.  Customizations are happily accommodated, certainly not the case at many restaurants.  

Though the wait staff seems to turn over regularly, every one we've gotten has been polite and attentive.  Jojo is our favorite, and she's been there as long as we've been going.

We have eaten Thai at various places around the country.  This place ranks in our top three, so lucky us, this one is close to home!
